required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility & Acceptability of a Virtual Sister Circle Intervention for Black Women With Depressive Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Feasibility and Acceptability of a Therapeutically-Grounded Virtual Sister Circle Intervention for Black Women With Depressive Symptoms

lead_sponsor.agency: Kia Skrine Jeffers, PhD, RN, PHN

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the feasibility and acceptability of a protocol for middle- and older-aged Black women with depressive symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Recruitment, completion, and retention rates of participants
primary_outcome.description: 80 percent recruitment, 80 percent completion, and 75 percent retention

primary_outcome.measure: Assess Acceptability according to the Theoretical Framework of Acceptability
primary_outcome.description: Qualitative assessment of Acceptability. The interview guide will be organized according to the constructs of the Theoretical Framework of Acceptability. Methodological conventions of qualitative description will be used to analyze the data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Perceived Stress Scale (PSS) from baseline at 8 weeks and 16 weeks
Changes in Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (PANAS) Scale from baseline at 8 weeks and 16 weeks
Changes in Acceptance and Action Questionnaire II (AAQ-II) from baseline at 8 weeks and 16 weeks

arm_group.description: During Weeks 1-8, Group 1 receives the Intervention and Group 2 receives no treatment.
During Weeks 9-16, Group 2 receives the Intervention and Group 1 receives no treatment.

intervention.description: The intervention is an 8-week, therapeutically-informed protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Identify as Black or African American
- Identify as female
- Age 40 years and older
- Community-dwelling
- Self-report of experiencing depressive symptoms
- Ability to commit to the 8-week intervention
- Access to Zoom
- Speak and read English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a diagnosis of bipolar, but is not taking medication for the condition
- Experiencing psychosis

overall_official.last_name: Kia Skrine Jeffers, PhD, RN, PHN

overall_contact.last_name: Kia Skrine Jeffers, PhD, RN, PHN

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Kia Skrine Jeffers, PhD, RN, PHN
